title: Is my ex still entitled to see my financial records even after 5 years of separation or after divorce is over? i fear that since
question: we are separated for 5 years and he has contributed debts and no asset to our marriage. now after i filed and tried to rebuild my life, he takes me to court for 5 years and tries to go through financial statements like a fine tooth comb during marriage and recently even my financial records after separation of 5 yrs, is this legal?
answers: The issue of what can be requested by and through discovery is a very complex and sophisticated issue. There is no attorney that can give you defined answers based on the two sentences you provided in your AVVO inquiry. The legal test is whether the discovery request reasonably calculated to lead to discoverable evidence. If you have issues concerning spousal support, child support, and separate verses community property; the other side probably has a lot of wiggle room. You really should consider retaining legal counsel in your area to assist you in this action. Quite frankly, there really is no simple magic dust to get rid of this troublesome problem.

Was a legal separation ever filed and judgment on distribution of assets and debts done in the legal separation? If not, then a full disclosure must be made to all parties and this includes all financial information. Seek legal assistance.

That depends. Is one of you paying support to the other? Has the court kept jurisdiction over support, or over property division?

If so, then he has the right to see your records.
